home.p1: Computer Science undergraduate (UFCAT) with 2 years of experience in a corporate IT environment, working directly with infrastructure and production support. Hands-on experience with Linux, Active Directory, networking and VPNs, plus data center routines focused on availability and service continuity. Strong focus on operational automation and continuous growth toward Cloud, DevOps and DevSecOps.
home.hl2: Access management, security policies and corporate networking
home.hl3: Java automation: ~10 minutes saved per operational ticket

about.p1: I'm a Computer Science undergraduate and an Industrial Automation technician, with hands-on experience in corporate IT environments. I have a strong analytical profile and I'm driven by problem-solving, working with infrastructure, systems administration and process automation in production environments.

card1.title: Profile
card1.desc: Solid Linux and systems administration foundation, with an operational mindset focused on troubleshooting, service continuity and continuous improvement in corporate environments.

card2.title: Differential
card2.desc: Clear communication and structured technical documentation (KBs, runbooks and operational standards). I turn technical knowledge into repeatable processes and automated solutions.

card3.title: Goal
card3.desc: Looking for an Infrastructure/Cloud Junior opportunity with a structured path toward DevOps and DevSecOps, applying automation, continuous integration, observability and security practices from development through operations.

box1.title: Cloud & DevOps
box1.desc: Oracle Cloud (VMs, networking and security), Google Cloud (GKE – studying), Docker, Kubernetes (deployments and orchestration concepts), CI/CD with GitHub Actions, Terraform/IaC fundamentals, IAM and access control.

box2.title: Programming & Backend
box2.desc: Java, Python, C/C++, Bash scripting, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, REST APIs, automation and tooling.

box3.title: Systems & Operations
box3.desc: Linux (3+ years), systems administration, structured troubleshooting, virtualization (KVM/QEMU, VirtualBox), basic hardening, technical documentation (KB/runbooks) and operational continuity practices.

box4.title: Security & DevSecOps (Foundations)
box4.desc: Least-privilege principles, secure system configuration routines, access control, basic hardening concepts, basic vulnerability awareness and traceability/auditability.

box5.title: AI & IoT
box5.desc: LLM integration (GPT/Gemini), prompt engineering, ESP32/LoRa projects, dashboards and remote control systems.
